channel.title: How to let an npc talk without clicking it?
channel.description:
I'd like to add all glnome trainers to my rsc, but I just can't figure out how to make them talk without clicking them.
If somebody could tell me how to do this, I'd be thankful.

item.title: How to let an npc talk without clicking it?
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

TannerRSC:

They actually were, as soon you clicked the next object, the npc cheered at you

You sure? I thought it was just spamming that after a certain delay.

Read full topic
item.source: How to let an npc talk without clicking it?

item.title: How to let an npc talk without clicking it?
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

else if(object.getID() == 223 && object.getX() == 274 && object.getY() == 566) { // Mining Guild Ladder if(owner.getCurStat(14) < 66) { owner.setBusy(true); Npc dwarf = world.getNpc(191, 272, 277, 563, 567); if(dwarf != null) { owner.informOfNpcMessage(new ChatMessage(dwarf, "Hello only the top miners are allowed in here", owner)); } world.getDelayedEventHandler().add(new ShortEvent(owner) { public void action() { owner.setBusy(false); owner.getActionSender().sendMessage("You need a mining level of 66 to enter"); } }); } else { owner.teleport(274, 3397, false); } }

Same concept would apply to gnome course… if the object is clicked have the npc cheer the player on. Although, I don’t remember the gnomes being activated by the ‘objects action’

Read full topic
